image.altText: Donald Trump stands in front of microphones with a helicopter sitting on a lawn to one side.

props.synopsis: The US and Israel appear to abandon Gaza talks, as the US president says Emmanuel Macron's declaration that France will recognise a Palestinian state "doesn't change anything".Â

title.children: Trump says Hamas doesn't want Gaza ceasefire deal and will be 'hunted down'

image.altText: Anthony Albanese G7

props.synopsis: The reality of the situation on the ground in Gaza, and the spectre of children dying of malnutrition or starvation, sits at such extraordinary odds with the language of spokespeople for both the Netanyahu government and the IDF.

title.children: The reality in Gaza shows Israel is at risk of becoming a global pariah

image.altText: A drone shot of a truck in a rural road

props.synopsis: A huge convoy of hay-laden trucks is making its way across the Nullabor from Western Australia to drought-stricken South Australia in what one young volunteer describes as a "journey of hope".

title.children: Convoy of drought relief trucks snake across Nullarbor

image.altText: On a red background, blurred images of children can be seen. In the foreground, the word ADVANCE is printed

props.synopsis: Conservative lobby group Advance used unblurred images of children taken from the YouTube accounts of education organisations without their consent, an ABC NEWS Verify investigation has found.

title.children: Advance used unblurred footage of children without parents' consent

image.altText: A pile of Australian and American money.

props.synopsis: The once almighty American dollar has been falling against almost every major currency ever since Donald Trump became the 47th US president.

title.children: Heading overseas soon? News of a strengthening Aussie dollar might not be good

image.altText: Turtle (Joni) on her back with her head being supported by a volunteer..

props.synopsis: CT scans, shell scrub-downs and custom moon boots â these are all in a day's work at the Magnetic Island sea turtle clinic. We followed the journey of two of the clinic's patients, and the people who care for them.

title.children: After 16 weeks recovering at a sea turtle clinic, Joni goes home

image.altText: a dark clouds covers the skyline of birdsville in queensland

props.synopsis: There are multiple indications the record drought across southern Australia is finally loosening its grip.

title.children: Most widespread rain in two years for southern Australia, with more to come

image.altText: A young woman hooked up to a machine in a hospital.

props.synopsis: Cancer diagnosis in young people is on the rise, but there are practical ways to support loved ones going through treatment.Â

title.children: The realities of getting a cancer diagnosis in your 20s or 30s

image.altText: An LNG flare flames out from a stack.

props.synopsis:
The International Court of Justice was unequivocal about the consequences for countries that make the climate crisis worse. As one of the world's biggest fossil fuel exporters, it puts Australia on notice.

Â

title.children: World Court lights match under Australia's fossil fuel export industry

image.altText: Two rocket launchers fire, sending large plumes of fire and smoke into densely-covered bushland

props.synopsis: Bangkok says it will consider the proposal which has been put forward by Malaysia, but says any deal must be based on "appropriate on-the-ground conditions".

title.children: Thailand agrees in principle to Cambodia ceasefire, thousands evacuate

image.altText: A mean wearing a life vest sits on a rock with his head in his hands.

props.synopsis: Trying to get to the UK is a treacherous journey for refugees. Even if they make it, growing protests and increasingly hard-line policies are waiting for them.

title.children: For asylum seekers, reaching the UK puts them in a ferocious political storm

image.altText: British and Irish Lions supporters dressed as lions with face paint

props.synopsis: The Wallabies must win at the Melbourne Cricket Ground on Saturday night to keep the Test series against the British and Irish Lions alive. Here is what you need to know about the second Test.

title.children: Lions vs Wallabies: How to watch, what time is kick-off and who is playing?

image.altText: A graphic image of batteries on houses.

props.synopsis: For the first time, battery sales in Australia have surpassed sales of solar panels. Now retail giant Bunnings wants a piece of the action.Â

title.children: Bunnings makes a play in 'hyper-competitive' solar, battery market

image.altText: A head shot of an older white woman with short light brown hair, wearing a red shirt, smiling warmly.

props.synopsis: Veteran broadcaster Geraldine Doogue AO looks at the longevity of the media industry and asks what next?

title.children: Geraldine Doogue on why the future of media doesn't have to be grim

image.altText: A man in a hat and dark suit walks among a pack of reporters outside a court building.

props.synopsis: The NSW government is demanding the immediate resignation of independent MP Gareth Ward, who has been found guilty of sexually abusing two young men.

title.children: Labor demands Gareth Ward resign after conviction for sex crimes

image.altText: Hogan, wearing a red "TRUMP" singlet and red bandanna on his head, points to one side with both hands.

props.synopsis: Hulk Hogan's life of signature wrestling moves gave way to racist rants, lawsuits bankrolled by venture capitalists and shirt-tearing displays on the Republican campaign stage.

title.children: Hulk Hogan's path from wrestling icon to right-wing mouthpiece

image.altText: Toby Greene and Tom Papley clash

props.synopsis: The Bulldogs soar back into the top eight with a demolition job on Bombers, while the Giants complete an incredible comeback win over the Swans in the Sydney Derby.

title.children: Giants blitz Swans in derby demolition as Greene calls Papley 'overweight'

image.altText: A screenshot of Reece Walsh's near match-winner for the Brisbane Broncos against the Parramatta Eels.

props.synopsis: Mitchell Moses's return sparks the Eels to a 22-20 win over the fifth-placed Broncos as Reece Walsh has a last-minute match-winner taken off him by the bunker.

title.children: Reece Walsh calls BS as bunker denies his last-minute match-winner

image.altText: A woman in white sneakers walking up stairs.

props.synopsis: While many people aim for 10,000 steps a day, new research finds 7,000 daily steps can provide meaningful health improvements and may be a more "realistic" goal.Â

title.children: Just 7,000 steps a day linked to big health gains, research finds

image.altText: A woman wearing a suit leaves a building through sliding glass doors.

props.synopsis: One of the most senior officers in the ranks of Western Australia's police force has been charged with stalking and illegally accessing a computer system.

title.children: One of WA's most senior police officers charged with stalking

image.altText: A woman with windswept, dark hair wearing a black coat and white blouse turns a street corner with autumn foliage.

props.synopsis: Former Miss Australia and Tasmanian MP Kathryn Hay is sentenced for emotional abuse and intimidation of her former husband Troy Richardson.

title.children: Suspended prison sentence for former Labor MP Kathryn Hay

image.altText: Rescue workers evacuate flood-affected residents

props.synopsis: Storms in northern China have poured nearly a year's rainfall on Baoding, an industrial city on the doorstep of capital Beijing, forcing over 19,000 people out of their homes.

title.children: Storms dump nearly a year of rain in northern China, Beijing braces for floods

image.altText: woman in black shirt speaks to media outside a polling booth in the philippines

props.synopsis: A guilty verdict would have seen the Philippine Vice President barred from running at the next election.

title.children: Impeachment case against Sara Duterte blocked by supreme court

image.altText: bride and groom kiss in the aisle of a flooded church

props.synopsis: A Filipino couple was undeterred by the extreme weather from tropical storm Wipha and chose to wade down the aisle in a flooded church.

title.children: Filipino couple get married in flooded church amid tropical storm Wipha

image.altText: Ghislaine Maxwell in a white shirt, grinning at the camera

props.synopsis: A top US Justice Department official spends hours interviewing Ghislaine Maxwell, the imprisoned accomplice of sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, as President Donald Trump struggles to tamp down a furore over his handling of the explosive case.

title.children: Epstein accomplice Ghislaine Maxwell speaks with US Justice Department

image.altText: An animated devil is in a bed next to an animated Donald Trump

props.synopsis: Just hours after Paramount bought global streaming rights for South Park in a billion-dollar deal, the 27th season opens with President Donald Trump begging Satan for sex.

title.children: South Park airs naked Trump parody as Paramount merges with Skydance

image.altText: Penny Wong walks smiling with man in front of Sydney Opera House

props.synopsis: Britain says it will deepen its AUKUS nuclear submarine partnership with Australia through a new 50-year treaty that it expects to create jobs and boost British exports.

title.children: UK and Australia deepen AUKUS submarine pact with 50-year treaty

image.altText: A screenshot of two people in an intimate embrace looking shocked

props.synopsis: Kristin Cabot was listed on the tech company's website as chief people officer, but her picture has since been removed.

title.children: Astronomer's chief HR officer resigns after Coldplay concert saga

image.altText: A film still showing a man wearing a blue superhero suit and white gloves and a 4 on his chest in front of a wall of flames

props.synopsis: Marvel's first family is back on the big screen with a retro aesthetic, a star-studded cast and a hunger to wipe the superhero movie slate clean.

title.children: Fantastic Four fails to make Pedro Pascal a traditional movie star

image.altText: A house with police tape around it and an officer standing in front of it

props.synopsis: A man dies after suffering a medical episode minutes after being tasered during an arrest in the Perth suburb of Embleton overnight, WA police say.

title.children: Man dies after being tasered by police in suburban Perth

image.altText: An illustration of a hot pink bill with blue and black liquid pouring out

props.synopsis: Australia's pharmaceuticals watchdog is investigating a spike in reports related to Vyvanse, the country's most commonly prescribed ADHD medication.

title.children: Australia's most common ADHD drug has had a spike in adverse event reports

image.altText: Shop front of a disability employment provider office

props.synopsis: A national disability employment provider, which supports more than 6,000 Australians living with a disability, has lost federal funding, ABC News understands.

title.children: Major disability employment provider tells staff it has lost federal funding

image.altText: A person inserts a needle into an ampoule.

props.synopsis: A Victorian doctor who wrote up nearly 200 false exemptions in one week during the height of the pandemic has had his appeal against his suspension dismissed.

title.children: Doctor who handed out vaccine, mask exemptions has appeal dismissed

image.altText: An elderly man sitting outdoors, smiling warmly while wearing a light gray hoodie

props.synopsis: The Walkley Award-winning journalist has been remembered as a "wonderful human being" at a heartfelt funeral in North Sydney on Friday.

title.children: ABC journalist Peter Ryan remembered as 'lovely bloke' at Sydney farewell
